case_vignette: A 13-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of a 1-month history of progressive difficulty breathing through his nose and a 2-week history of recurrent severe nosebleeds. When he holds the right nostril shut, he is unable to breathe nasally and his sense of smell is reduced. He has a 6-year history of asthma, which is well controlled with inhaled albuterol. Vital signs are within normal limits. Nasal inspection shows a pink, lobulated mass filling the left nasal cavity. The septum is deviated to the right side. The mass bleeds on touch. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most appropriate next step in diagnosis?
correct_ans: ct scan of head with contrast

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having trouble breathing through my nose for the past month and I've been getting really bad nosebleeds for the past two weeks.
Have you had any other symptoms such as coughing, chest pain, or difficulty swallowing?
No, I haven't had any other symptoms like coughing, chest pain, or difficulty swallowing.
Have you had any history of allergies or nasal polyps?
I have a history of asthma, but I haven't been told about any allergies or nasal polyps specifically.
Have you been taking any medications for your asthma?
Yes, I've been using an inhaled albuterol for my asthma.
Have you noticed any changes in your asthma control or symptoms recently?
My asthma has been well controlled, and I haven't noticed any recent changes.
Have you had any family history of respiratory issues or allergies?
I don't have information about my family's medical history regarding respiratory issues or allergies.
Final Diagnosis: Asthma exacerbation with nasal congestion and nosebleeds.
